sn51.33-44:1: "Bhikkhus, just as the river Ganges slants, slopes, and inclines towards the east, so too a bhikkhu who develops and cultivates the four bases for spiritual power slants, slopes, and inclines towards Nibbāna.
sn51.33-44:2: "It is in this way, bhikkhus, that a bhikkhusn.v.91develops and cultivates the four bases for spiritual power so that he slants, slopes, and inclines towards Nibbāna."
sn51.33-44:3: Six about slanting to the eastAnd six about slanting to the ocean.These two sixes make up twelve:Thus the subchapter is recited.
